io
Class CourseListReader

java.lang.Object
  io.CourseListReader

public class CourseListReader
extends java.lang.Object

Reads all the Courses from a file. Every line should contain the information for a Course, with the course ID, title, and number of credits all on the same line, separated by commas. Instances are effectively immutable once input is read.

Invariants:
  • TODO invariant1

Version:
May 30, 2011: Class created.
Author:
Jonathan Caddey

Method Detail

read

public void read(java.util.Scanner the_scanner)
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                 InputFormatException
Reads the input of Scanner as a list of Courses. See class description for the required formatting.

Preconditions:
  • Input has not been successfully read before.
  • the_scanner != null
  • the input is properly formatted
Postconditions:
  • All courses within the input are represented in the return.

Parameters:
the_scanner - can retrieve properly formatted input.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if input has already successfully been read.
InputFormatException - if the format of the input is not as described in class documentation.

parseCourse

protected Course parseCourse(java.lang.String the_string)
                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                             java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             InputFormatException
Parses a line to get a Course. The line must contain the course ID, title, and credits, separated by commas.

Preconditions:
  • the_string is properly formatted.
  • the_string is not null
Postconditions:
  • none

Parameters:
the_string - contains information for a Course.
Returns:
the Course represented in the_string.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the_string is null.
InputFormatException - if the_string is not properly formatted.
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the credits is not an integer
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the credits is negative.

getCourseMap

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Course> getCourseMap()
                                                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Preconditions:
  • input has been read.
Postconditions:
  • does not return null.

Returns:
a mapping of course IDs to Courses.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if invoked before input is read.
